definition: short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: One of the ships turned its gun turret on a Japanesereconnaissance plane.
sentences.chinese: 其中一艘舰只将炮管瞄向日方侦察机。

sentences.english: He was flown out in a tiny Stork spotter plane to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 他乘着一架怪鸟式小型侦察机飞抵罗马。

sentences.english: So the first scouts start the landing operation.
sentences.chinese: 首批侦察机开始空降行动。

sentences.english: I sometimes use the otus when defending, initially, to detect any camoflauged snipers trying to slip through.
sentences.chinese: 最初我会用队长侦察机用于防守，这可以发现侦察兵。

sentences.english: In 1955, the company's top-secret U2 reconnaissance aircraft made its first flight.
sentences.chinese: 1955年，该公司绝密的U2侦察机完成首次飞行。

sentences.english: Several search planes, along with a Coast Guard cutter, came and went.
sentences.chinese: 几架侦察机和一艘海岸警卫队快艇来了又走了。

definition: early warning aircraft system, e.g. US AWACS
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
to form into columns/to organize into teams/formation (of ships or aircraft)
